description: Ms. codex. Title supplied by cataloger, according to Mach, R. Yahuda. 15 lines per page. Written in medium large naskh in black ink with use of red and green ink. Light cream paper with laid and chain lines and pulp visible. The text starts on fol. 2b. Autograph dated Wednesday 17 Dhū al-Ḥijjah 857 [Dec. 19, 1453] (fol. 9a). Incipit: الحمد لله الذى حعل الحمد لكتابه مفتاحا ولقلوب اوليائه مصباحا ... [3أ] ... وبعد فكتاب الله جليل كريم ... [4أ] وبعد يقول العبد الفقير ... ابو اليمن محمد بن على بن اسمعيل بن عمر بن عبد الرحمن المصرى ولدا والقدسى اصلا والشافعى مذهبا ... اننى قرات من اول فاتحة الكتاب العزيز
author: Miṣrī, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī, b. 1436
abstract: Autograph thabat by Abū al-Yaman Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn Ismaʻīl ibn ʻUmar ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Miṣrī al-Qudsī (see fol. 4, l. 11-12) [b. 839/1436, see Sakhāwī, al-Daw al-lāmiʻ, vol. 8, 171], consisting of a list of books read, beginning with the Qurʼān in various readings, the Kitāb al-Taysīr by Abī ʻAmr al-Dānī, the Shāṭibīyah by Abū al-Qāsim al-Shāṭibī, etc. read with Abū al-ʻAbbās Aḥmad ibn Zayn al-Dīn Abī Bakr ... al-Qilqīlī al-Shāmī, known as al-Sikandarī, nazīl al-Jāmiʻ al-Azhar (fol. 5a) [757-857/1356-1453, see Sakhāwī, al-Daw al-lāmiʻ, vol. 1, p. 263-264], with an ijāzah, followed by two autograph attestations of this ijāzah, one from Jaʻfar ibn Ibrāhīm ibn Jaʻfar ibn Sulaymān ibn Hubayr ibn Jarīr ibn ... ibn Faḍl fāḍil al-Qarashī al-Maqarrī al-Sanhūrī al-Azharī, nazīl al-Diyār al-Miṣrīyah wa-al-Qāhirah, dated 19 Dhū al-Ḥijjah 857 (fol. 9a-10b) [ca. 810-894/1407-1489, see Sakhāwī, al-Daw al-lāmiʻ, vol. 3, p. 67-70], the other from ʻAlī ibn Yūsuf al-Jabartī (fol. 10b) [see Sakhāwī, al-Daw al-lāmiʻ, vol. 6, p. 53].
creator: Miṣrī, Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī, b. 1436
مصري، محمد بن علي
subject: Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī Abū al-Yaman, b. 1436—Books and reading
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
